text: Brett Reed (born May 29, 1972) is an American college basketball coach and the current head men's basketball coach for the Lehigh University Mountain Hawks. Reed is known most notably for Lehigh’s upset over the Duke Blue Devils in the 2012 March Maddness Tournament. Lehigh was the 15 seed and knocked off the highly touted Duke program as the number 2 seed in the tournament. ==Experience== Prior to being named the head coach at Lehigh, he was an assistant coach from 2002 until 2007. Reed also served as an assistant coach at High Point, UNC Greensboro and Oakland Community College. His only prior head coaching experience was at Canterbury School in Florida. ==Education== Reed received a bachelor's degree in literature from Eckerd College in 1995. He earned both a master's degree in 1998 and a Ph.D. in instructional technology with a cognate in sports administration in 2003 from Wayne State University. ==Head coaching record== == References == ==External links== * Lehigh profile Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:American men's basketball coaches Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball coaches from Michigan Category:Basketball players from Michigan Category:College men's basketball head coaches in the United States Category:Eckerd Tritons men's basketball players Category:Lehigh Mountain Hawks men's basketball coaches Category:People from Waterford, Michigan Category:Point guards Category:UNC Greensboro Spartans men's basketball coaches Category:Wayne State University alumni Category:Eckerd College alumni
title: Brett Reed (basketball)
